result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarfina M Butler

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:03 AM Defendant Sarfina M Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarfina M Butler.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests another status date to get the blood results for the OWI. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re: bond reduction

***ALSO $2,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** 
Charges per attached INFORMATION. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

9:55 AM Defendant Sarfina M Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarfina M Butler.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

***ALSO $2,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** 
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarfina M Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Sarfina M Butler. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State calls Investigator Diener, DSAT
Direct by the state
Defense on cross.
Parties rest.
State asks court take Judicial notice that defendant was on felony bond at the time of the alleged offense.
Court takes Judicial notice that defendant was on felony bond
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects. 
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on charges
Defense asks bond be lowered to a lower cash so the defendant can bond out if their hold were to be lifted.
State believes bond set to be appropriate 
BTC: Bond motion granted to $350 cash and $2000 signature bond.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarfina M Butler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Sarfina M Butler. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
